channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16062] Improper error handling in WAL Reader/Writer creation
item.description: If creation of WAL reader/ writer fails for some reason RS may leak hanging socket in CLOSE_WAIT state.
item.summary: Improper error handling in WAL Reader/Writer creation

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: patch for master. cc: Ted Yu

Some context is here:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HBASE-9393?focusedCommentId=15337251&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-15337251

Nice finding, Vlad.


317	            if (stream != null) {

318	              stream.close();	318	              stream.close();

319	            }	319	            }

320	            if (reader != null) {

321	              reader.close();

322	            }

What if stream.close() throws exception ?

What if stream.close() throws exception ?

I think reader.close() will throw as well. If you want I can add try ... catch inside catch, Ted Yu.
